chapter.title: The OPAC module
chapter.para: OPAC stands for Online Public Access Catalogue. The OPAC module allows readers to carry out a search in the library catalogue.
In fact, the PMB OPAC module is a WebPAC : an OPAC accessible via the Web.
How to configure the OPAC is described in the PMB Administrator's Guide.
The OPAC can be separate from the PMB management interface, and placed on a separate server. For more information about installing the OPAC consult the PMB Installation Guide.
Note this chapter isn't the OPAC help, but only a quick aide-memoire. A Guide to the PMB OPAC is currently in preparation.

sect1.title: Accessing the OPAC
sect1.para: The OPAC catalogue of the PMB-managed library will be accessible by default at the following internet address :
However, for the other workstations on a local network, you need to replace localhost by the network name of the PMB server.
To obtain this name under Windows, right-click on My Computer then select Network ID. You will then be shown the name of the machine on the local network.

The online catalogue produced by PMB is dynamic: It is automatically updated at each reload of the page. Therefore an update made in the management interface (see following sections) is reflected immediately. A newly catalogued item is also accessible immediately in the OPAC.

sect1.title: The OPAC Interface
sect1.para: The PMB OPAC displays 3 main areas of information on the screen

listitem.para: A "search" dialogue area is found at the top of the page.
New : Starting with version 1.3, the OPAC offers an advanced search feature.

Subject headings are presented in the bottom right area. Other blocks can also be displayed. The OPAC is highly configurable. For more information, consult the Administrator's Guide , Utils chapter, Parameters section.

The left column (which can be deactivated from Administration > Utils > Parameters) offers the possibility to identify the barcode of the reader and the address of your library. The library's addresss is parameterisable in Administration > Utils > Parameters (For more information consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, Utils chapter).

sect1.title: Key word search
sect1.para: If you enter a term in the "Search" textbox, the OPAC will display the results of your search. You can further refine your search by ticking or unticking the boxes which correspond to the elements which were queried : title, author, collection...

New : since version 1.3, the PMB OPAC stores throughout the duration of your session (from the start of your connection, that is to say the first OPAC window that you opened) the searches you have undertaken.

sect1.title: Browsing the categories
sect1.para: Concieved to allow a facilitated exploration of the resources, the categories correspond to a heirarchical thesaurus whch must be entered into PMB to be used.

sect1.title: Acces to the reader's account from the OPAC
sect1.para: Readers registered in the management interface can access their account from the OPAC. That need for this their reader's bar code, which is found on their library card, as well as their password.
Note : by default this password is identical to the reader's bar code. It can be changed in the management interface, or at any time by the reader through accessing their account in the OPAC.
